page.title: 10A BRANT BROUGHTON HORSEMAN
page.content: I went to see{ Lionel Dunning}the professional show jumper who lives on High Street to ask him some questions.He said he had lived in the village since 1973.He said he had 20 horses.He first got involved with horses when he was 10.He enters about 50 shows a year.I then asked him which is his best horse,he said William Curtis.He said his best achievement in horse jumping was 6 double clear rounds in 1 year on 1 horse in the Nations Cup.He said that he and his wife enter many shows together.A person would expect to pay about Â£25,000 for a good horse he said.Then I asked what advice would he give to someone who wanted to become a horse jumper and he said,"No don't".I finally asked him which book about him does he like best. He replied,"Dead Lucky".
